Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey. How you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Thinking about my grandmother a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: She was about to turn 97.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: At least she lived a very long and I'm sure, a very happy life. Got you this card. When you're ready. We all signed it. We just wanted you to know we're thinking about you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Thank you. "Congratulations, Darryl. Let's get wasted." "Have fun today, big guy." "Aww, yeah. Party time. Whoo-whoop."

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's possible that some people thought it was your birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: "Hooray. Live it up big D. " "Days like this don't come often enough. Time to celebrate. You deserve this"?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Birthday punches! [softly punching Darryl in the stomach] One two three four five sice seven eight!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [tears welling up in his eyes]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: ...thirteen fourteen fifteen sixteen seventeen eighteen nineteen twenty twenty-one twenty-two twenty-three twenty-four twenty-five twenty-six!...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: ...So I got an early res at Blue Wasabi and I'm taking Rachel. She's picking me up after work.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Rachel from the party?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Nice. Do the damn thing. - Pow! [they fist bump and explode]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Blue Wasabi is so good, but get the cheeseburger. They say they won't do it, but they will if you make a scene.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Okay, bye. Okay, bye. [kisses Michael] I'll miss you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Miss you. Okay. I'll be in my office if you need me.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, bye. Bye. All right, bye. Bye... bye.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Okay, one more quick one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't go. I don't want you to go. Oh don't go. Don't go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Holly and I are dating. It's been a week, and I still can't believe it. [sighs] It goes to show that everything you want in life, you get. And you can't work for it. It just comes to you.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: And what do we have here?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: From my secret admirer. That's you!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I dominate Valentine's Day. I practically make romance into a science.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: "Roses are red. Violets are blue. Look in the vase to find your first clue." Oh, my gosh. It's a romantic scavenger hunt!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Oh, close. It's a romantic treasure hunt. A scavenger hunt is where you find items from a master list. This is where you follow clues that lead to a prize. Common misuse. Good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: But, there's no clue.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Well, get to work.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I can't, 'cause there's no clue.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: The puzzle is the clue.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [clears throat]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [rubbing hands with Holly] Are these numbers correct?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: The numbers are correct, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [clears throat more loudly]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you... are you sick, Oscar? Do you need to go home? 'Cause you're grossing me out.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I jus... I just need a signature.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [getting out of a taxi] There you go. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How much did you give him?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Big tip.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wait. I don't have my scarf.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm missing my scarf. Oh. [both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We decided to have a Valentine's day lunch and then that way we can spend the entire night with Cece and avoid the Valentine's day dinner thing. It's a whole thing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [loudly] Yeah, lunch was wonderful!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Shh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, there was an amazing buffet and there was a chocolate fondue... station. And what else was there?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, bottomless champagne.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes. Never found that bottom, did we?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Psst! Psst!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Are you good at jigsaw puzzles?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me? It's all I did every summer when my brothers were out sailing.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: But if there is a romantic thing with Gabe, I should probably...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh! No, no, no, no. It's not weird at all. You have your new girlfriend. I have Gabe. This is just as friends.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, okay then.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: At least until Stanley calms down.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, is he...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: D...d...d...d...don't look. I accidentally did his Sudoku. [Stanley glares at Andy]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] All right, I will fax over it to you. Whoop. I will fax it over to you. Okay. Thank you. [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, my name is j...j...j...j...j...j...j...j Jim Halpert and I will fax it in to you... under you. I'll fax it under you. Oh, excuse me. I just p...p...p...p pissed my pants. Not really. I didn't really. [clears throat]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [goes to hand Dwight a valentines card] Wait.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're just filling that out right now. That wasn't meant for me. I will not be your Valentine.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Aww, nuts. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't know if anyone else feels this way and don't get me wrong, I love Michael and Holly, and maybe I'm being overly sensitive, but... the PDA.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes! The freaking PDA!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Thank you! I mean, I'm thrilled for them.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No one is more thrilled for them than I am...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes, yes, absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: ...but it's totally inappropriate.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's a little much.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Obviously, so happy for them both.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: So happy. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I don't know, guys. I, for one, enjoy watching them, because...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, stop! Just don't.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Kevin!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Can I finish? Can I finish? Is that okay? I was saying...I enjoy watching them because it makes me horny.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [groans]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: God! Kevin!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: So tell me about your new girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: She's neat. Uh, I met her at Darryl's cousin's party. We were the only two white people there.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Aww, cute.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, look at that. Done.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: That's Gabe's boom box. Come on. We have to go find it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I wish you well on your quest.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Aww, I mean...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [growling] Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Ha!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [to Toby] I hear them kissing all the time. It's this horrible plipping sound. You know, it's like Chinese water torture. Just...[makes popping sound] like it's coming from my own head.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sit. Okay, just close your eyes. [massaging Holly's back]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Ohh. Can you get lower?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: A little lower.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I cannot keep myself from Michael. Everything he does is sexy. He has this undeniable animal magnetism. He's a jungle cat. The man exudes sex. He can put both his legs behind his head.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Thank you all for meeting on such sort notice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [clears throat]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sitting in Holly's lap] Yes. Michael Scott, Dunder Mifflin. What is the purpose of this meeting?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Seeing as it's Valentine's Day, I felt it would be apropos to have a little refresher course on romance in the workplace.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Perfect. Yes. It is quite apro-propriate. Carry on.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: First things first. An office romance is permissible. Not something you'd expect to hear from corporate. Well, guess what. Sabre is 100% tolerant of office romances.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Speaking of, Gabe, I don't see Erin at this meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Uh, I also don't see Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oooh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OOH! Boom! Face!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I get it. Andy's slamming my girlfriend. Very funny. What I do not approve of, however, is public displays of affection, or PDAs. PDAs are totally superfluous to a happy, healthy office romance. Perfect example. Look at Jim and Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. What? Us?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: They don't touch. They don't kiss. You would hardly even know that they were husband and wife.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did it!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Love it. Keep it goin.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Okay. So, PDAs. That's gonna include behaviors such as hugging, kissing, uh...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Booby honking.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yeah, booby honking. Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Butt honking.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Butt honking. Yeah, all the honking.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: The one where you start in a crouches position, then you leap...

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Sure. Basically, there's no precise definition, but you know it when you see it. Ahem.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Are you guys listening to this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What, are you talking about me and Holly?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Maybe you find your own chair.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: So we kiss occasionally.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Not occasionally. All the time.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, and it's not just the kissing. It's the flirtatious whispering.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: The flirtatious tickling.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whispering and tickling have their place in business.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That thing were you softly exhale on her neck.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... Okay, yeah, that's pretty hot. I will give you that. Look, you are all hypocrites. You all do it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael. Confession:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, it's great. I love working at Dunder Mifflin, a division of Taliban enterprises.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's weird. I mean, that's weird to have sex in the office. That's where you work, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know, you're in a meeting, and nobody knows that you've had sex there, except for you and him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [snorts] Ew.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Don't mind us. You keep working.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Okay. I'll keep working.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. It's a song.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What do you think is on it?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [softy] We should actually probably talk about it outside or we might make Darryl mad.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [softly] Not if we're talking like this. I think it's okay. He doesn't seem to hear us.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I think he can hear us.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [softly] That makes sense, 'cause I feel like I'd be able to hear us at this level.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Darryl is a jerk.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No, he's not.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, I'm just testing if he can hear.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I can hear you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay. Then no more talking. Let's just play the song.

Quote.Speaker: Boom Box
Quote.Text: [Gabe singing] The temp at night. The temp at night. The temp at night. The temp at night.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The temp at night?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What do you...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You got it. Pick it up. Take it out.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Pi...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Pick it up.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Take it out. Pick it up. Pick it up. Pick it up. Take it out.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Right. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Sorry to interrupt. Forgot to collect my things.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, the old "leave behind." Oldest trick in the book. Good thing it's working.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, no. Michael, I don't want to make people uncomfortable.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Since when is comfort the most important thing? I mean, I don't... I don't sit on your lap because it's comfortable. I sit on your lap because I like the way your thighs feel on my butt.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yeah, but if they're uncomfortable, it makes me uncomfortable.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Okay. Well, if it makes you uncomfortable, then we'll stop.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Holly and I are like Romeo and Juliet. And this office is like the dragon that kept them apart.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, you know why people here are complaining? They are jealous of two people in love on Valentine's Day.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Two people in love?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love you.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Wait, wait, wait, what do you mean you love me? We've only been dating for a week. Do you mean you love me like, "oh, hey, there's Holly. I love that girl." Or you do you mean you love me like you love me-love me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love you-love you.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Wow, you love me-love me. I love you-love you. [both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am really disappointed in the office's policy on PDA at this moment. I love you. [shakes Holly's hand]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I love you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, whatever. No big deal. Just the hottest girl in the world loves me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, Ryan's the temp. What does he do at night?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I guess we just have to wait until night and see.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, or maybe not. [turns out the lights]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [gasps] Oh. Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: How romantic is this?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Super romantic.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Right. Do you see a clue or...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah. Did you not see it? ["Eat at Hanks" is written in glow-in-the-dark letters above the door]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, my gosh.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hanks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim and Pam
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Andy and Erin
Quote.Text: [bursting out of Ryan's closet] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No time to chat.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, we were just looking for Ryan, so he's not here.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey. You're looking for me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, we were. We were just looking to say hi. So hey.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No you weren't.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, we weren't.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You wanted to have sex in my office.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Definitely not. That's disgusting.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No. It's... it's cool. Just try to put everything back were you found it. Text me when you're finished. I'll be out here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, you don't have to...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That was so embarrassing. I'm gonna die.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That was really rough.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Let me make something clear. Jim and I have never and will never have sex in the office.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, because the office isn't what I'd consider a romantic place.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Besides, we have something those other people don't have, which is a home and a bed.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And a shower.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, Holly.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here, shake. No!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No, don't touch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, we can't.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No touching.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No touching. Ah, I'm trying not to touch you.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Almost got you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no, so close. Oh. No, we can't do that. We can't do this. Ohh.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: You're not touching me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know what your body feels like 'cause I can't touch it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay, this is much worse than before.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, I agree. This is nasty.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Grab you here.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: And here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will grab you here anyway. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: You have to cut it out.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Never.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: You said you would.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did say I would, but I was wrong. I can't stop. You don't what it is like to love a woman and have her love you back. It is a feeling that cannot and will not, and frankly, cannot be contained.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: No one is a bigger fan of sexual touching than me. But with you two, it's reaching the level of a complex. I can think of three explanations. One:

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Give me all your money and take off your clothes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're not supposed to PDA.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Come one. Nobody's looking. What's wrong?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I haven't thought about you having to go back to Nashua.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Maybe we didn't want to think about it. We can make it work. We'll date long-distance.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what we said last time. Remember? We broke up on the drive. How's this gonna be any different?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: We weren't in love last time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was in love with you.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I'm not saying it won't be hard. But we can make it work. That's what she said.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [chuckles, sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh. One Erin Special, please.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Here's your bottle of sparkling cider.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [laughs] That's my favorite.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: I'm now supposed to tell you to enjoy a mind-hunt break and look for a heart or some [bleep] in the break room when you're through.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [through the window at Michael] Hey, buck up, buddy!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Make that face he likes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey. Hey. Come on. You're hurting him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's like a time bomb...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...is ticking down. When it goes off, no more kissing. No more hugging.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just hush.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sexual time bomb.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just rock. Shh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [into recorder] Boner Bomb starring Jason Statham. Or we go against type with an Eisenberg or a Michael Cera.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Movie idea?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. [into recorder] Saving the world has never been this hard.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. Shh. Have you talked to her about your feelings? Women really go for that crap.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I can't talk to her. I can't even look at her without thinking about it ending.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kevin! Do more stupid faces.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Which one? I have a lot of stupid faces.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do the monkey face.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do the monkey face!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love that. I love that face.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good. He loves it. Good. Jump. Jump up and down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. The monkey!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Go back to the monkey!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't do the squirrel. Throw your poop.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hurl your feces.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's good. He's throwing it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They really do that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [at vending machine] B-9.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Like a benign tumor.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Maybe it's just more like, "be mine."

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, yes. There's a note. "A little cookie for you, my miss. But the real treasure is your Valentine's kiss."

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mm.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Mm. Oh. We're suppose to...mmm [leans in to kiss Andy]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hmm. [points to Gabe blowing a kiss to Erin]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Holly. Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Holly, I love you so, so, so much. And I think we need to break up.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: What? What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Actually, it's Valentine's Day. Shouldn't be doing this today. I'll talk to you tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No, we're gonna talk now. You're not breaking up with me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're gonna go back to Nashua eventually, and I can't handle it. So let's just...let's...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: What if I said it wasn't up to them?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: The company. Nobody knows our future, but it's not gonna be decided by the company. It's not gonna be decided by anybody but us. What we are is up to you and me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ladies and gentlemen, I have an announcement to make. As of today, officially, Holly and I are moving into together. Yay! [claps] Thank you. Thank you. Oscar, this must be tough for you, watching this go down. You could not stand in the way of true love, my friend!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Are you kidding? I wasn't trying to break you guys up.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Better luck next time, pal.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, the point is, there will no longer be any need for PDA here at the office between us because, when we get home, we are going to make love to and with one another, and that, to me, is the best Valentine's Day present that a person could receive. So I bid you all adieu.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: You do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Go on. Kiss each other already. [they kiss]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Suck it, Oscar. This must kill you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I just told them to do it!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. We took a walk.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We took a walk.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My perfect Valentine's Day? I'm at home, three cell phones in front of me, fielding desperate calls from people who want to buy one of the 50 restaurant reservations I made over six months ago.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Anybody can be Prince Charming one day a year with the dinner and the flowers and all that. But you know what impresses me? When a guy can do that no days a year.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Flowers, diamonds, three-course meal, violinist comes to my table to serenade me...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Pizza, soda, the moon, someone to share it with.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are our plans for tonight? Umm...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [imitates a squeaky bed] [laughter]
